levelledPara.title: Floor Structure Performance Test Procedure
levelledPara.para: This data module describes the performance test procedure for the Center Body Floor Structure (53-10-40).

levelledPara.title: Test Objectives
levelledPara.para: To verify that the Floor Structure meets all structural performance requirements, including load bearing capacity, stiffness, and fatigue resistance under expected operational conditions.

levelledPara.title: Prerequisites
levelledPara.para: Before performing this test, ensure the following conditions are met:

listItem.para: Floor structure is properly installed per installation procedures
All attachment points are secured to design specifications
Test equipment is calibrated and operational
Safety precautions are in place

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Ensure all personnel are clear of the test area before applying loads. Use proper support structures to prevent collapse.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Monitor load distribution to prevent overload of any single attachment point.

levelledPara.title: Required Test Equipment
levelledPara.para: The following test equipment is required:

listItem.para: Distributed load application system (load pads or ballast weights)
Strain gauges and data acquisition system
Displacement measurement devices (dial indicators or LVDTs)
Load cells for attachment point monitoring
High-speed camera for dynamic testing
Verify that all prerequisites have been met.
Install strain gauges at designated measurement points on floor beams and panels.
Set up displacement measurement devices at critical locations.
Apply uniformly distributed load of 5 kN/m² as baseline.
Incrementally increase distributed load in steps of 2.5 kN/m² up to 20 kN/m² (design load).
Record strain, displacement, and load distribution data at each increment.
Hold at maximum test load for 10 minutes.
Remove load incrementally, recording data at each decrement.
Perform visual inspection for any signs of damage, permanent deformation, or fastener failure.
Conduct dynamic impact test by dropping a 100 kg mass from 0.5 m height onto floor panel.

levelledPara.title: Acceptance Criteria
levelledPara.para: The Floor Structure passes the performance test if:

listItem.para: No visible cracks, fastener failure, or permanent deformation observed
Maximum recorded strain is within design allowables
Maximum vertical displacement is less than 10 mm at design load
Permanent set after unloading is less than 0.2 mm
No damage observed after impact test
Load distribution among attachment points is within 15% variation

levelledPara.title: Data Recording
levelledPara.para: Record all test data in the approved test report form. Include:

listItem.para: Date, time, and test personnel
Floor structure serial number and configuration
Test equipment identification and calibration dates
All load, strain, and displacement measurements
High-speed video recording of impact test
Pass/fail determination and signatures
